heroIntro:
Discover sophisticated coastal living in this exceptional 3-bedroom villa located in the prestigious Sierra Cortina district of Finestrat, Alicante. Priced at €790,000, this premium property offers discerning buyers an unparalleled opportunity to acquire a luxury residence at 40% below comparable Spanish island markets—a remarkable value proposition in today's competitive real estate landscape.

This carefully appointed villa showcases refined design across 230 square meters of living space on a generous 409-square-meter plot, providing the perfect balance between intimate family living and entertaining distinguished guests. Sierra Cortina has established itself as one of Costa Blanca's most sought-after residential enclaves, attracting affluent homeowners and investors who appreciate understated elegance, privacy, and access to the region's finest amenities.

With an impressive price point of €3,435 per square meter—significantly above the Finestrat average of €2,200/m²—this property reflects superior construction standards and premium specifications that justify its position in the luxury segment. The established market trend of +8% year-on-year growth, combined with strong rental potential (€800+ per week), positions this acquisition as both a prestigious residence and a prudent investment for those seeking exposure to Europe's most dynamic coastal property market.
areaSection: Finestrat, a charming hilltop municipality in the Marina Baixa region of Alicante, commands a privileged position on the Costa Blanca with stunning Mediterranean vistas and excellent connectivity to major centers. The town's elevation provides natural protection from excessive summer heat while capturing the region's renowned 300+ days of annual sunshine. Sierra Cortina, perched above the coast, offers the optimal balance of accessibility to beaches and restaurants while maintaining exclusive residential tranquility. The microclimate in this elevated area creates particularly pleasant conditions year-round, making it ideal for those who value both comfort and natural beauty. Finestrat's infrastructure has matured considerably, with excellent roads connecting residents to Benidorm, Alicante city, and the region's world-class amenities, all within 20-40 minutes by car.
lifestyleSection: Living in Finestrat as a resident of Sierra Cortina places you at the intersection of sophisticated Mediterranean living and international cosmopolitanism. The established expatriate community—predominantly Northern European professionals and retirees—has created a welcoming, English-speaking environment without sacrificing authentic Spanish character. Daily life encompasses leisurely mornings at any of several Blue Flag beaches just 15-20 minutes away, followed by shopping at well-stocked Mercadona and Lidl supermarkets, or exploring weekly farmers' markets for fresh local produce. The dining scene reflects both traditional Spanish gastronomy and international cuisine, with acclaimed restaurants and tapas bars within easy reach. Healthcare is exceptionally accessible, with private English-speaking clinics and regional hospitals providing world-class medical services. For those with professional or academic interests, several British curriculum international schools serve the expatriate families in the region, ensuring continuity of education standards.
investmentSection: From an investment perspective, this Sierra Cortina villa presents compelling metrics for discerning purchasers. The regional market has demonstrated consistent growth of +8% year-on-year, outpacing inflation and European residential property averages. At €3,435/m², this property commands a premium to Finestrat's €2,200/m² average, reflecting its superior specifications and prestigious location—yet remains 40% undervalued compared to equivalent properties on Spanish islands such as Mallorca or Ibiza. Rental yield potential is substantial, with comparable 3-bedroom villas in the area commanding €800+ per week during peak season, translating to annual rental income exceeding €30,000 for owners seeking to monetize their acquisition. Whether purchased as a principal residence, holiday retreat, or pure investment asset, this villa's position within an appreciating market segment, combined with strong tourism demand and international buyer interest, suggests favorable long-term capital appreciation alongside immediate lifestyle benefits.
conclusion: This exceptional villa in prestigious Sierra Cortina represents a rare acquisition opportunity within Costa Blanca's luxury residential market. The combination of premium specification, favorable pricing relative to comparable Mediterranean properties, strong investment fundamentals, and access to refined Mediterranean lifestyle creates a compelling proposition for discerning international buyers. Whether seeking a principal residence, holiday retreat, or investment asset, this property delivers measurable value alongside intangible benefits of prestigious location and cosmopolitan community. Contact us via WhatsApp to arrange a private viewing and explore how this villa aligns with your Mediterranean aspirations.

lifeAndAmenities.intro: Finestrat offers the sophisticated infrastructure and refined amenities expected by international residents, with healthcare, education, shopping, and transportation all accessible within minutes. The established expatriate presence means English-language services are readily available throughout daily life, without compromising authentic Mediterranean character.

healthcare.text: Healthcare in Finestrat meets the highest international standards, with multiple options for residents. The Marina Baixa Hospital, located 22 minutes away, provides comprehensive emergency and specialist services with English-speaking physicians and modern diagnostic equipment. Private health clinics throughout the region offer direct appointments without NHS-style waiting periods, and many specialists cater explicitly to international patients. The healthcare system in Spain is internationally recognized for quality and efficiency, with costs substantially lower than UK equivalents. Prescription medications are affordable and readily available at pharmacies (farmacias) in every neighborhood, and health insurance for expatriates is accessible at competitive rates through multiple international providers.
keyPoints: Marina Baixa Hospital - comprehensive services, 22 minutes drive
Multiple private clinics with English-speaking doctors - 10-15 minutes
24-hour emergency services and urgent care facilities nearby

education.text: International education options in the Finestrat region cater to expatriate families seeking continuity with British, American, or other curricula. The British School of Benidorm, located 15 minutes away, maintains IB accreditation and serves families from primary through secondary levels. Additional international schools throughout the region offer Spanish instruction alongside English-medium education, facilitating smooth cultural integration while preserving academic standards. The region has developed robust educational infrastructure specifically to serve the substantial international community, ensuring quality instruction and peer environments reflecting the cosmopolitan demographic.

shopping.text: Daily shopping in Finestrat is exceptionally convenient, with major supermarket chains and traditional markets within 10-15 minutes. Mercadona and Lidl provide familiar product selections and competitive pricing, while weekly farmers' markets in the town center offer fresh seasonal produce directly from regional suppliers. The Carrefour shopping center, 10 minutes distant, provides comprehensive retail options including fashion, electronics, and home furnishings alongside dining establishments. Specialty food shops catering to expatriate preferences—stocking British goods, international cuisine ingredients, and familiar brands—are scattered throughout the region, eliminating any sense of deprivation from Mediterranean living.

Weekly farmers' markets - fresh local produce and Spanish delicacies

transport.text: Transportation around Finestrat and the broader Costa Blanca is straightforward, though car ownership is recommended for maximum flexibility. Alicante-Elche Airport, serving 45 minutes away, provides direct flights to major European cities including London, Paris, Amsterdam, and Scandinavia, with multiple daily connections to UK airports. Local bus services connect towns throughout the region, though routes and frequencies are optimized for Spanish schedules rather than tourist convenience. Driving is pleasant on well-maintained motorways and regional roads, with parking readily available throughout Finestrat. The proximity to Benidorm and Alicante city means cultural attractions, shopping, and entertainment are all accessible without excessive travel time.

faqs.question: Сколько стоит эта недвижимость?
faqs.answer: €790,000. This 3-bedroom villa represents exceptional value for premium Costa Blanca property, priced 40% below comparable Spanish island markets. Payment options including mortgage arrangements for qualified foreign buyers are available through established financial institutions.

faqs.question: Является ли Коста-Бланка хорошим местом для покупки недвижимости?
faqs.answer: Yes, absolutely. Costa Blanca has demonstrated consistent 8% year-on-year appreciation, supported by strong international buyer demand, excellent infrastructure, and established expatriate communities. The region offers superior value compared to other Mediterranean destinations while maintaining world-class amenities, healthcare, and lifestyle quality.

faqs.question: Могут ли иностранцы купить недвижимость в Испании?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreign nationals have the same property acquisition rights as Spanish citizens. Non-resident foreign buyers require a Spanish tax identification number (NIE), and some regions have established procedures specifically facilitating international transactions. Legal guidance from a Spanish property attorney ensures compliance with all regulatory requirements.

faqs.question: Каковы расходы на покупку недвижимости в Испании?
faqs.answer: Beyond the purchase price, expect approximately 8-10% in additional costs: property transfer tax (4-5%), notary fees (1-2%), property registration (0.5-1%), and legal representation (0.5-1%). These are standard, transparent costs that Spanish legal professionals manage routinely with international clients.

faqs.question: Какова стоимость жизни на Коста-Бланке?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca offers remarkable value compared to northern Europe. Monthly expenses for a retired couple range from €1,200-€1,800, including utilities, groceries, dining, and entertainment. Healthcare, groceries, and dining are substantially less expensive than UK equivalents while maintaining excellent quality standards.

faqs.question: Подходит ли Коста-Бланка для пенсионеров?
faqs.answer: Excellent, yes. Costa Blanca has become Europe's premier retirement destination, with established expatriate communities, excellent healthcare, favorable climate, low cost of living, and abundant cultural amenities. Spain's Non-Lucrative Visa specifically facilitates retirement residency for qualified applicants.

faqs.question: Как далеко Коста-Бланка от России?
faqs.answer: Alicante-Elche Airport is 45 minutes from Finestrat, with direct flights to London, Manchester, and Birmingham taking approximately 2.5 hours. This accessibility makes weekend returns to the UK entirely feasible, while proximity to mainland Europe creates broader travel opportunities.

faqs.question: Какая погода на Коста-Бланке?
faqs.answer: Exceptional. The region enjoys 300+ days of annual sunshine with average temperatures of 20-28°C year-round. Summers (June-September) are warm and dry, while winters remain mild (12-18°C), making the climate ideal for outdoor living and water activities throughout the year.

faqs.question: Can I rent this property to tourists?
faqs.answer: Yes, short-term rental is permitted in Spain. This villa's 3-bedroom configuration and Sierra Cortina location command €800+ per week during peak season, translating to potential annual rental income exceeding €30,000. Professional property management companies throughout the region handle rental marketing, guest relations, and maintenance.

faqs.question: What makes Sierra Cortina prestigious?
faqs.answer: Sierra Cortina has evolved as Costa Blanca's most established luxury residential enclave, characterized by elevated positioning providing Mediterranean vistas, mature landscaping, privacy, and proximity to world-class amenities. The area attracts affluent international residents and has maintained consistent value appreciation.
